A **revenant**, Z, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The revenant is a type of [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") that is the [strongest](/wiki/Strong "Strong") monster of the [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Zombie (EvilHack)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

A revenant has a weapon attack and a [paralyzing](/wiki/Paralyzing "Paralyzing") touch, and possesses [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"), and a [vulnerability](/wiki/Vulnerability "Vulnerability") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage.

[Chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to a revenant will freeze the character in place for a few turns, ignoring [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action") as with the [skeleton](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton").

## Generation

Revenants are always generated hostile, and will never be generated randomly in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

A trio of revenants are generated near the up stair on the second floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") at level creation. Four revenants are generated on the second level of [Vecna's Domain](/wiki/Vecna%27s_Domain "Vecna's Domain") at level creation, and twelve are generated on the third level at level creation.

A character killed by any type of [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)") will arise as a revenant instead of a [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") if a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file is created - characters that die this way have a small chance of being able to continue play as a revenant with intrinsic [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging").

## Encyclopedia entry

Will rose. Ser Waymar Royce stood over him. His fine clothes were  
a tatter, his face a ruin. A shard from his sword transfixed the  
blind white pupil of his left eye. The right eye was open. The pupil  
burned blue. It saw. The broken sword fell from nerveless fingers.  
Will closed his eyes to pray. Long, elegant hands brushed his cheek,  
then tightened around his throat. They were gloved in the finest  
moleskin and sticky with blood, yet the touch was icy cold.  
\[ A Game of Thrones, by George R. R. Martin ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Revenant\&action=edit)*

html:
Revenant

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Z revenant (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Weapon 2d8, Touch 1d6 paralysis
Z revenant (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Weapon 2d8, Touch 1d6 paralysis

Base level 12
Base experience 305
Speed 9
Base AC 1
Base MR 30
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 300
Nutritional value 5
Size Medium
Resistances cold, sleep, poison, petrification, level drain
Resistances conveyed None

A revenant:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2747

A revenant, Z, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. The revenant is a type of undead that is the strongest monster of the zombie monster class.

A revenant has a weapon attack and a paralyzing touch, and possesses cold resistance, sleep resistance, poison resistance, drain resistance, stoning resistance, and a vulnerability to fire damage.

Chatting to a revenant will freeze the character in place for a few turns, ignoring free action as with the skeleton.

Generation

Revenants are always generated hostile, and will never be generated randomly in Gehennom.

A trio of revenants are generated near the up stair on the second floor of the Ice Queen's Realm at level creation. Four revenants are generated on the second level of Vecna's Domain at level creation, and twelve are generated on the third level at level creation.

A character killed by any type of lich will arise as a revenant instead of a ghost if a bones file is created - characters that die this way have a small chance of being able to continue play as a revenant with intrinsic unchanging.

Encyclopedia entry

Will rose. Ser Waymar Royce stood over him. His fine clothes were
a tatter, his face a ruin. A shard from his sword transfixed the
blind white pupil of his left eye. The right eye was open. The pupil
burned blue. It saw. The broken sword fell from nerveless fingers.
Will closed his eyes to pray. Long, elegant hands brushed his cheek,
then tightened around his throat. They were gloved in the finest
moleskin and sticky with blood, yet the touch was icy cold.
[ A Game of Thrones, by George R. R. Martin ]

A '''revenant''', {{brightblue|Z}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The revenant is a type of [[undead]] that is the [[strong]]est monster of the [[Zombie (EvilHack)|zombie]] [[monster class]].

A revenant has a weapon attack and a [[paralyzing]] touch, and possesses [[cold resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[drain resistance]], [[stoning resistance]], and a [[vulnerability]] to [[fire]] damage.

[[Chatting]] to a revenant will freeze the character in place for a few turns, ignoring [[free action]] as with the [[skeleton]].

==Generation==
Revenants are always generated hostile, and will never be generated randomly in [[Gehennom]].

A trio of revenants are generated near the up stair on the second floor of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] at level creation. Four revenants are generated on the second level of [[Vecna's Domain]] at level creation, and twelve are generated on the third level at level creation.

A character killed by any type of [[Lich (monster class)|lich]] will arise as a revenant instead of a [[ghost]] if a [[bones]] file is created - characters that die this way have a small chance of being able to continue play as a revenant with intrinsic [[unchanging]].
